text.tspan: "CAM algorithms take fairly simple geometry primitives as input
and produce as output a toolpath"
"a toolpath is essentially a collection of curves connected
end-to-end, but may also contain some special symbols"
"a toolpath is essentially a collection of curves connected
end-to-end, but may also contain some special symbols"
Find G2 and G3 arcs with tolerance and plane
"a library of tools that can be used for CAM operations"
"given a toolpath, a tool, and stock size this code simulates
cutting and calculates the remaining stock"
Output: remaining stock (probably as a Surface object)
- Compare milled stock to original design surface
-- allows seeing if the CAM algorithm works well
- Match-stick model is OK for 3-axis milling (no undercuts)
-- more sticks could be added adaptively where smaller tolerance
-- would allow simulating any G-code program, not only toolpaths
-- let's not reinvent a G-code interpreter in this project!
